1.name: Bulbasaur
1.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

2.name: Ivysaur
2.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

3.name: Venusaur
3.description: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

4.name: Charmander
4.description: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

5.name: Charmeleon
5.description: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

6.name: Charizard
6.description: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

7.name: Squirtle
7.description: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

8.name: Wartortle
8.description: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

9.name: Blastoise
9.description: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

10.name: Caterpie
10.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

11.name: Metapod
11.description: This Pokémon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

12.name: Butterfree
12.description: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

13.name: Weedle
13.description: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp stinger on its head that injects poison.

14.name: Kakuna
14.description: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

15.name: Beedrill
15.description: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

16.name: Pidgey
16.description: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

17.name: Pidgeotto
17.description: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

18.name: Pidgeot
18.description: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

19.name: Rattata
19.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

20.name: Raticate
20.description: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

21.name: Spearow
21.description: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

22.name: Fearow
22.description: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

23.name: Ekans
23.description: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.

24.name: Arbok
24.description: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

25.name: Pikachu
25.description: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms.

26.name: Raichu
26.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

27.name: Sandshrew
27.description: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food.

28.name: Sandslash
28.description: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

29.name: Nidoran♀
29.description: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

30.name: Nidorina
30.description: The female’s horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

31.name: Nidoqueen
31.description: Tough scales cover the sturdy body of this Pokémon. It appears that the scales grow in cycles.

32.name: Nidoran♂
32.description: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

33.name: Nidorino
33.description: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

34.name: Nidoking
34.description: Uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break its prey's bones.

35.name: Clefairy
35.description: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

36.name: Clefable
36.description: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

37.name: Vulpix
37.description: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older.

38.name: Ninetales
38.description: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

39.name: Jigglypuff
39.description: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

40.name: Wigglytuff
40.description: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

41.name: Zubat
41.description: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

42.name: Golbat
42.description: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

43.name: Oddish
43.description: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

44.name: Gloom
44.description: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn’t drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

45.name: Vileplume
45.description: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

46.name: Paras
46.description: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

47.name: Parasect
47.description: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

48.name: Venonat
48.description: Its large eyes act as radars. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

49.name: Venomoth
49.description: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

50.name: Diglett
50.description: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

51.name: Dugtrio
51.description: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

52.name: Meowth
52.description: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

53.name: Persian
53.description: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

54.name: Psyduck
54.description: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

55.name: Golduck
55.description: Often seen swimming elegantly by lakeshores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa.

56.name: Mankey
56.description: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant.

57.name: Primeape
57.description: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught.

58.name: Growlithe
58.description: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

59.name: Arcanine
59.description: A legendary Pokémon in China. Many people are charmed by its grace and beauty while running.

60.name: Poliwag
60.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

61.name: Poliwhirl
61.description: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

62.name: Poliwrath
62.description: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

63.name: Abra
63.description: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

64.name: Kadabra
64.description: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close.

65.name: Alakazam
65.description: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

66.name: Machop
66.description: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

67.name: Machoke
67.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

68.name: Machamp
68.description: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

69.name: Bellsprout
69.description: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture.

70.name: Weepinbell
70.description: It spits out poison powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of acid.

71.name: Victreebel
71.description: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

72.name: Tentacool
72.description: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

73.name: Tentacruel
73.description: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

74.name: Geodude
74.description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

75.name: Graveler
75.description: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

76.name: Golem
76.description: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage.

77.name: Ponyta
77.description: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time.

78.name: Rapidash
78.description: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

79.name: Slowpoke
79.description: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

80.name: Slowbro
80.description: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps.

81.name: Magnemite
81.description: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.

82.name: Magneton
82.description: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

83.name: Farfetch’d
83.description: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword.

84.name: Doduo
84.description: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

85.name: Dodrio
85.description: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

86.name: Seel
86.description: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

87.name: Dewgong
87.description: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

88.name: Grimer
88.description: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

89.name: Muk
89.description: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

90.name: Shellder
90.description: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

91.name: Cloyster
91.description: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

92.name: Gastly
92.description: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

93.name: Haunter
93.description: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

94.name: Gengar
94.description: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

95.name: Onix
95.description: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black.

96.name: Drowzee
96.description: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating only bad dreams.

97.name: Hypno
97.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

98.name: Krabby
98.description: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

99.name: Kingler
99.description: One claw grew massively and is as hard as steel. It has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is too heavy.

100.name: Voltorb
100.description: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, they have zapped many people.

101.name: Electrode
101.description: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

102.name: Exeggcute
102.description: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

103.name: Exeggutor
103.description: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

104.name: Cubone
104.description: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this Pokémon's real face.

105.name: Marowak
105.description: Small and weak, this Pokémon is adept with its bone club. It has grown more vicious over the ages.

106.name: Hitmonlee
106.description: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

107.name: Hitmonchan
107.description: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see.

108.name: Lickitung
108.description: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

109.name: Koffing
109.description: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

110.name: Weezing
110.description: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, two Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.

111.name: Rhyhorn
111.description: Its massive bones are 1,000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

112.name: Rhydon
112.description: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees.

113.name: Chansey
113.description: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.

114.name: Tangela
114.description: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.

115.name: Kangaskhan
115.description: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old.

116.name: Horsea
116.description: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

117.name: Seadra
117.description: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

118.name: Goldeen
118.description: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen.

119.name: Seaking
119.description: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

120.name: Staryu
120.description: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

121.name: Starmie
121.description: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value it as a gem.

122.name: Mr. Mime
122.description: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

123.name: Scyther
123.description: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.

124.name: Jynx
124.description: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

125.name: Electabuzz
125.description: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

126.name: Magmar
126.description: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

127.name: Pinsir
127.description: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

128.name: Tauros
128.description: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

129.name: Magikarp
129.description: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

130.name: Gyarados
130.description: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

131.name: Lapras
131.description: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

132.name: Ditto
132.description: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

133.name: Eevee
133.description: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.

134.name: Vaporeon
134.description: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

135.name: Jolteon
135.description: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

136.name: Flareon
136.description: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1,600 degrees.

137.name: Porygon
137.description: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

138.name: Omanyte
138.description: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

139.name: Omastar
139.description: Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.

140.name: Kabuto
140.description: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor.

141.name: Kabutops
141.description: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

142.name: Aerodactyl
142.description: A ferocious, prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

143.name: Snorlax
143.description: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

144.name: Articuno
144.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

145.name: Zapdos
145.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

146.name: Moltres
146.description: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

147.name: Dratini
147.description: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

148.name: Dragonair
148.description: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

149.name: Dragonite
149.description: An extremely rare, highly intelligent Pokémon. Able to circle the globe in just sixteen hours.

150.name: Mewtwo
150.description: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

151.name: Mew
151.description: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
